title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4300.30 - Data transmission protocols
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4300.30 - Data transmission protocols

State Regulations
(a) An authorized pari-mutuel wagering entity
using a wagering device-to-tote network may use whatever communications
protocol it selects. (b) A remote
site is considered part of a tote-to-tote network and is subject to the
requirements of section
4300.24
of this Part, relating to
hardware requirements. (c) If the
failure to compile pools or payout winning prices is isolated to a remote site, the stopping of wagering or the manual cashing and accounting of tickets need
only occur at the affected site. The relevant information must be transmitted
between the CPU and the remote site through the established communication links
or facsimile machine and must be verified. Such manual merges are prohibited
unless required specifically by law or regulation and approved by the
commission. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
4300.30

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
